page.title: 16River Severn- Leisure
page.content: The banks on both sides of the River Severn can be walked, through meadows and woods. The main fish are Chub and Barbel, for which this is the best reach in the Midlands. Fishing rights are owned by clubs such as Kidderminster District Angling Assoc- iation, Bewdley A A, White Swan A A, half being privately owned.KDAA charge Â£7.50 per year (no day tickets) for June 16 to March 16.Competitions, open to anyone, are held each Wednesday and some weekends. Bewdley Rowing Club and canoeists from local towns use this stretch of river; raft races, usually charity events, pass by.In Summer the water is shallow but can rise 10-15ft in Winter. The proposed Severn Navigation Scheme, opposed by conservationists and fishermen,would widen parts of the river and allow motor boats upstream.
